ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] InstancePerThread interface
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon, Thanks for responding so quickly. ... Ok I don t need this functionality, they are sufficiently thread-safe. ... How do we override this politeness

Hi Gordon,

Thanks for responding so quickly.

> 'InstancePerThread' is mea=
nt to signify that a Processor is 
> not sufficiently thread-safe to let a =
single instance serve 
> for all ToeThreads. It was previously needed for o=
ne of our 
> default Processors (I think it was FetchHTTP), but is not 
> c=
urrently used by any standard Processors, and thus may not 
> have been rec=
ently tested/maintained to work properly.

Ok I don't need this functionali=
ty, they are sufficiently thread-safe.
 
> If you are configuring your craw=
l with many ToeThreads, but 
> only seeing one active, it's most likely tha=
t's because the 
> standard politeness behavior -- never opening more than =
one 
> connection to a single hostname and never hitting a single 
> hostna=
me too rapidly -- make it so that with your crawl, no 
> more than a single=
 (or small
> number) of threads is ever needed.

How do we override this po=
liteness functionality and is that possible?  The
only option I saw about p=
oliteness is IP-Politeness under the Frontier, and
either setting of False/=
True provides the same results.

> How many hosts are you trying to crawl? =
What does a 'threads 
> report' and 'frontier report' show during the crawl=
 -- are 
> there an excess of 'READY' queues in the frontier while 
> threa=
ds sit idle?

I am also only working on one hostname.
